description:
People have created many stories. Joy, sadness, anger, deep emotion. Stories stir up emotion and captivate. However, those emotions are nothing more than the feelings of a spectator. What if the characters in the stories had their own "will"? In their eyes, are we, the creators of the stories, like gods? Revolution for our world. Punishment for the land of the gods.

Re:CREATORS. Everyone becomes a Creator.

(Source: Amazon)

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.din.or.jp/~redbear/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroerei)

He is known as Red Bear from TEX-MEX when doing doujinshi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.

[Website](http://www.din.or.jp/~redbear/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroerei)

He is known as Red Bear from TEX-MEX when doing doujinshi.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

__[Website](http://www.ayanomashiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ma_shi_ron) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ayanomashiro)__

Mashiro Ayano pre-debuted in volume 17 of LisAni! (May 2014 issue) as Mashiro in "Wingless Diver," as well as volume 18 (August 2014 issue) in "Setsuna Chronicle (刹那クロニクル)." She major-debuted in singing _Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works_ (TV) OP "ideal white" in October 2014.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Official Site](https://www.phantasia.jp/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/3pasiofficial/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5WmX340gDNLIAyUcg4MzWN) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/3_phantasia) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4lk0Ob-F3ptOQUUq8s0pzQ)

Sangatsu no Phantasia is a Japanese music unit which is signed to Sacra Music. It consists of vocalist [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia), whose music videos and promotional images are illustrated by various artists. The unit began activities in 2015 when it uploaded its first song "Day Break" on YouTube, before making its major debut in 2016. In addition to producing music, Mia also writes novels, with some of the unit's songs being based on her novels.

**Members:** 

- Vocals: [Mia](https://anilist.co/staff/272155/Mia)
- Composer: [Scop](https://twitter.com/scopscop)
- Illustrator: [Natsu Asami](https://twitter.com/72desuyo)
- Composer: [n-buna](https://twitter.com/nabuna2)
- Composer: [Yuuyu](https://twitter.com/yuuyu_ssry)
- Composer: [40mp](https://twitter.com/40mP)
- Composer: [buzz-G](https://twitter.com/buzz_g)

Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Masatoyo Takada is an episode director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i4longman) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/36619)

Mechanical designer, illustrator and painter. Currently resides in Kanagawa, Japan.

Best known for his work on 86 EIGHTY-SIX.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
